CHAT.comment: context notes say mother in college now
Home Visit 5 Chi sits on Mot's lap and Mot holds the book
sometimes Mot whispers a word to Chi that she is having problems with. Mot speaks very softly at these times and they may not all have been transcribed
Book Reading; The Very Hungry Caterpillar

Chi is not a very strong reader , but she gets by. She reads one word at a time , following with her finger. Mot gives her cues and hints or something , but I'm not sure exactly what her strategy is because Mot is hard to hear on the tape. Chi asks Mot to find the leaf as she reads. Did Mot ask this in BR1 , 2 , 3? It appears that Chi uses contextual cues to boost her reading. For example , she has no trouble reading the days of the week , but pauses before less predictable words in the text. Near the end of the book it is very likely that Mot is telling Chi what many of the words are , but only Chi is heard on the tape.

MOT goes off to talk to other kids in the room

not read as slowly as first time she read this refrain
turns to Mot to see if she's pronouncing right; presumably Mot nods
scrunches up her face while trying to pronounce strawberries
sound of joy

notes say Sis has whispered text to Mot and that Chi is just repeating , but she does seem to be sounding out a few words , like one; notes also say Mot points to each picture and food word as Chi reads

laughing at picture of fat caterpillar
I have a feeling that Chi was prompted to say <wasn't> and perhaps other words in this sentence

context notes say when Chi stuck on a word she is silent until Mot tells what the word is . I have a feeling that much of the end of the book is read this way .
